Speaker: convicts
Dialogue: Ha - Ha -

Speaker: convicts
Dialogue: Look down, look down Sweet Jesus doesn't care.

Speaker: convicts
Dialogue: Look down, look down They've all forgotten you.

Speaker: convicts
Dialogue: Look down, look down Don't look'em in the eye.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Now Prisoner 24601. Your time is up And your parole's begun. You know what that means?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Yes. It means I'm free.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: No! It means you get Your yellow ticket-of-leave.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: This badge of shame You'll show it everywhere. It warns you're a dangerous man.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: I stole a loaf of bread My sister's child was close to death And we were starving.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: You will starve again Unless you learn the meaning of the law.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: I know the meaning of those nineteen years A slave of the law!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Five years for what you did, The rest because you tried to run. Yes, 24601!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: My name is Jean Valjean!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: And I'm Javert! Do not forget my name. Do not forget me - 24601!

Speaker: convicts
Dialogue: Look down, look down You'll always be a slave. Look down, look down You're standing in your grave.

Speaker: innkeeper
Dialogue: My inn is full.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Jailer. Would you let me stay here for tonight?  JAILER This is a prison, not an inn. Get yourself arrested. Then we will open up for you.  The grate slides shut. As Jean Valjean walks away, some children who have been following begin throwing stones at him. He threatens them with his stick and they scatter.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Come in, sir, for you are weary And the night is cold out here. Though our lives are very humble What we have we have to share.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: There is wine here to revive you. There is bread to make you strong. There's a bed to rest till morning - Rest from pain, and rest from wrong.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Madame, set one more place.  Please sit.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: May the Lord bless the food we eat today. Bless our dear sister and our honoured guest.  Please, eat. Where are you travelling to my brother?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Pontarlier.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Is that where your family is?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: No. The destination is compulsory. That is where the Law sends me. I have no home.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Then let this be your home, for as long as you need it.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Sleep well. Tomorrow morning before you leave you will have a cup of milk from our cows, nice and hot.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: You let me sleep here next to you? How do you know I'm not a murderer?

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: God will take care of that.

Speaker: constable
Dialogue: Monsignor, we caught the thief red-handed! He has the nerve to say you gave him all this!

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: That is right.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: But my friend, you left so early, You forgot I gave these also. Would you leave the best behind?

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: Messieurs, release him. For this man has spoken true. I commend you for your duty Now God's blessing go with you.

Speaker: bishop
Dialogue: But remember this, my brother - See in this some higher plan. You must use this precious silver To become an honest man. By the witness of the martyrs,

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: What have I done? Sweet Jesus, what have I done? Become a thief in the night Become a dog on the run! And have I fallen so far And is the hour so late That nothing remains but the cry of my hate? The cries in the dark that nobody hears Here where I stand at the turning of the years.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: I am reaching, but I fall And the night is closing in... As I stare into the void - To the whirlpool of my sin.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Another story must begin!

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: At the end of the day you get nothing for nothing! Sitting flat on your bum doesn't buy any bread!

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: Give that letter to me It is none of your business. With a husband at home And a bit on the side! Is there anyone here Who can swear before God She has nothing to fear? She has nothing to hide?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: What is this fighting all about? Will someone tear these two apart? This is a factory, not a circus.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Now come on, ladies, settle down. I run a business of repute.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Deal with this, Foreman. Be as patient as you can.

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: Now someone say how this began!

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: Yes, it's true there's a child And the child is my daughter And her father abandoned us, Leaving us flat. Now she lives with an innkeeper man and his wife And I pay for the child. What's the matter with that?

Speaker: factory women
Dialogue: At the end of the day she'll be nothing but trouble And there's trouble for all when there's trouble for one! While we're earning our daily bread She's the one with her hands in the butter - You must send the slut away Or we're all going to end in the gutter And it's us who'll have to pay At the end of the day!

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: I might have known the bitch could bite! I might have known the cat had claws! I might have guessed your little secret! Ah yes, the virtuous Fantine Who keeps herself so pure and clean - You'd be the cause, I had no doubt Of any trouble hereabout. You play a virgin in the light But need no urging in the night!

Speaker: factory women
Dialogue: Sack the girl today!

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: Right, my girl! On your way!

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: M'sieur Mayor, help me! I have a child!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: I introduce myself, Inspector of Police. I've come to take the watch I'm here to keep the peace. Please know me as Javert.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Welcome, sir Come guard our laws I'm sure we're here In common cause.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: You've done the city proud, You've raised their banner high.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: The dignity of toil To stay alive.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: It seems to me We may have met.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Your face is not a face I would forget.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Get back! It may fall!

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: No, Monsieur le Mayor!

Speaker: crowd
Dialogue: It'll kill you as well!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Can this be true? I don't believe what I see! A man your age To be as strong as you are! A memory stirs... You make me think of a man From years ago A man who broke his parole.. He disappeared.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Forgive me, sir. I would not dare -

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Say what you must. Don't leave it there.

Speaker: fauchelevent
Dialogue: Monsieur le Mayor, you come from God! You are a saint!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Monsieur le Mayor.

Speaker: sailor 1
Dialogue: I smell women! Smell'em in the air! Think I'll drop my anchor In that harbour over there!

Speaker: sailor 2
Dialogue: Lovely ladies! Love `em till your broke! Seven months at sea can make you Hungry for a poke!

Speaker: sailor 3
Dialogue: Even stokers need a little stoke!

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: Don't touch me! Leave me alone!

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: It pays a debt...

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: What can I do? It pays a debt. Ten francs may save my poor Cosette.

Speaker: whores
Dialogue: Quick and cheap is underneath the pier  Fantine reaches the hair crone.  FANTINE Please, you wouldn't have any work for me would you? Please, I sold you my hair. I could do anything.  The hair crone points at the head whore and the tooth man.

Speaker: tooth man
Dialogue: I do it fast, I know my business all right. It's worth a go.

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: You'll pay me first What I am due.

Speaker: tooth man
Dialogue: You'll get twice If I take two!

Speaker: pimp
Dialogue: Cheer up, deary! Show a happy face! Plenty more like you here If you can't keep up the pace.

Speaker: pimp
Dialogue: Gimme the dirt - Who's that bit over there?

Speaker: pimp
Dialogue: I might've known There is always some man.

Speaker: pimp
Dialogue: Lovely lady, come along and join us! Lovely lady!

Speaker: whore 1
Dialogue: Come on, dearie, why all the fuss?

Speaker: whore 2
Dialogue: You're no grander than the rest of us.

Speaker: whore 3
Dialogue: Life has dropped you at the bottom of the heap.

Speaker: whore 1
Dialogue: Make money in your sleep!

Speaker: whore 2
Dialogue: That's right, dearie, Show him what you've got!

Speaker: whore 3
Dialogue: That's right, dearie, Let him have the lot!

Speaker: whores
Dialogue: Old men, young men, take'em as they come! Harbour rats and alley cats And every kind of scum! Poor men, rich men, leaders of the land - See them with their trousers off, They're never quite as grand! All it takes is money in your hand!

Speaker: whores
Dialogue: Lovely ladies Going for a song,

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: Easy money lying on a bed. Just as well they never see The hate that's in your head! Don't they know they're making love To one already dead?

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: There was a time when men were kind, When their voices were soft And their words inviting. There was a time when love was blind And the world was a song And the song was exciting. There was a time... Then it all went wrong.

Speaker: bamatabois
Dialogue: Here's something new. I think I'll give it a try. Come closer, you! I like to see what I buy. The usual price For just one slice of your pie.

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: I don't want you! No! No, M'sieur! Let me go!

Speaker: bamatabois
Dialogue: Is this a trick? I won't pay more!

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: No, not at all!

Speaker: bamatabois
Dialogue: You've got some nerve, you little slut! You've got some gall! It's the same with a tart as it is with a grocer The customer sees what he gets in advance It's not for the whore to say "yes sir" or "no sir" It's not for the harlot to pick and to choose or to lead me a dance!

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: I'll kill you, you bastard! Try any of that! Even a whore who has gone to the bad Won't be had by a rat!

Speaker: bamatabois
Dialogue: By Christ you'll pay for what you've done! This rat will make you bleed, you'll see! I guarantee I'll make you suffer! For this disturbance of the peace For this insult to life and property!

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: I beg you, don't report me, sir. I'll do whatever you may want.

Speaker: bamatabois
Dialogue: Make your excuse to the police!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Tell me quickly what's the story. Who saw what and why and where? Let him give a full description, Let him answer to Javert! In this nest of whores and vipers Let one speak who saw it all. Who laid hands on this good man here? What's the substance of this brawl?

Speaker: bamatabois
Dialogue: Javert, would you believe it? I was walking, it was dark When this prostitute attacked me You can see she's left her mark!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: She will answer for her actions When you make a full report. You may rest assured, M'sieur, That she will answer to the court.

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: There's a child who sorely needs me, Please, m'sieur, she's but that high. Holy God, is there no mercy? If I go to jail she'll die.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: I have heard such protestations Every day for twenty years. Let's have no more explanations,

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: A moment of your time, Javert. I do believe this woman's tale.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Monsieur le Mayor!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: You've done your duty. Let her be. She needs a doctor, not a jail.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Monsieur le Mayor!

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: Can this be?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Where will she end - This child without a friend?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: I've seen your face before. Show me some way to help you. How have you come to grief In such a place as this?

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: M'sieur, don't mock me now, I pray It's hard enough I've lost my pride. You let your foreman send me away. Yes, you were there And turned aside. I never did no wrong.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Is it true what I've done -

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: My daughter's close to dying.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: - to an innocent soul?

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: If there's a God above -

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Had I only known then!

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: He'd let me die instead.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: In His name my task has just begun. I will her to the hospital.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Monsieur le Mayor!

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: Bring Cosette back to me.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Where is she?

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: At an inn in Montfermeil...

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Monsieur le Mayor!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: I will see it done! I will send for her immediately!

Speaker: javert's assistant
Dialogue: From Paris, Monsieur.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Monsieur le Mayor I have a crime to declare! I have disgraced The uniform that I wear. I've done you wrong, Let no forgiveness be shown. I've been as hard On every rogue I have known. I'll bear the blame, I must be treated Just the same.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: I don't understand. What is this crime, Javert?

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: I mistook you for a convict, I have made a false report. Now I learn they've caught the culprit - He's about to face the court.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: And of course the thief denies it, You'd expect that from a con. But he couldn't run for ever, No, not even Jean Valjean.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: You say this man denies it all, And gives no sign of understanding or repentance? You say this man is going to trial, And that he's sure to be returned to serve his sentence?

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: He will pay, and so must I. Press charges against me, sir!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: You have only done your duty It's a minor sin at most. All of us have been mistaken You'll return, sir, to your post.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Must I do as you say?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: It's your duty to obey!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: They think that man is me - Without a second glance. This stranger they have found - This man could be my chance!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: I am the master of hundreds of workers - They all look to me. Can I abandon them? How would they live If I am not free?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: My soul belongs to God, I know, I made that bargain long ago. He gave me hope when hope was gone! He gave me strength to journey on! Who am I? Who am I? I'm Jean Valjean!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: And so, your honour, you see it's true That man bears no more guilt than you! Who am I? 24601!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: If you don't believe me ask Inspector Javert. He knows where to find me.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Is her daughter with her?

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: No, monsieur. Her guardian sent this.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: `Money not enough. Send more. Thenardier.' What sort of man is this?

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: Cosette, it's turned so cold! Cosette, it's past your bedtime! You've played the day away And soon it will be night.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Dear Fantine, Cosette will be here soon! Dear Fantine, she will be by your side

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: Come Cosette, the night has grown so cold!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Be at peace! Be at peace ever more.

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: My Cosette -

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: - shall live in my protection.

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: Take her now!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Your child will want for nothing.

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: Good m'sieur, you come from God in heaven.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: And none shall ever harm Cosette as long as I am living.

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: Take my hand... The night grows ever colder.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Then I will keep you warm.

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: Take my child I give her to your keeping.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Take shelter from the storm.

Speaker: fantine
Dialogue: For God's sake, please stay till I am sleeping... And tell Cosette I love her And I'll see her when I wake...

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Valjean, at last We see each other plain! `M'sieur le Mayor' You'll wear a different chain!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Before you say another word, Javert, Before you chain me up like a slave again, Listen to me! There is something I must do. This woman leaves behind a suffering child. There is none but me who can intercede - In mercy's name, three days are all I need, Then I'll return, I pledge my word! Then I'll return...

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Believe of me what you will There is a duty that I'm sworn to do. You know nothing of my life - All I did was steal some bread. You know nothing of the world - You would sooner see me dead. But not before I see this justice done!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Men like me can never change. Men like you can never change. No, 24601! My duty is to the law. You have no rights. Come with me, 24601!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: I am warning you, Javert, I'm a stronger man by far! There is power in me yet! My race is not yet run!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: There is no place for you to hide.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Your child will live within my care -

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Wherever you may hide away -

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: And I will raise her to the light.

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: There is a castle on a cloud I like to go there in my sleep. Aren't any floors for me to sweep, Not in my castle on a cloud.

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: Now look who's here! The little madam herself, Pretending once again She's been so awfully good! Better not let me catch you slacking! Better not catch my eye! Ten rotten francs your mother sends me - What is that going to buy? Now take that pail, My little Mademoiselle, And go and draw some water from the well. We should never have taken you in In the first place - How stupid the things that we do! Like mother, like daughter, the scum of the street.

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: Please do not send me out alone. Not in the darkness on my own.

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: Enough of that, or I'll forget to be nice! You heard me ask for something, And I never ask twice!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: My band of soaks, My den of dissolutes, My dirty jokes, my always pissed as newts, My sons of whores, Spend their lives in my inn! Homing pigeons homing in - They fly through my doors, And their money's as good as yours!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Welcome, m'sieur! Sit yourself down And meet the best Innkeeper in town!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: As for the rest - All of them crooks Rooking the guests And cooking the books. Seldom do you see Honest men like me A gent of good intent Who's content to be -

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Master of the house! Doling out the charm Ready with a handshake And an open palm

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Tells a saucy tale Makes a little stir Customers appreciate a bon-viveur Glad to do a friend a favour Doesn't cost me to be nice But nothing gets you nothing Everything has got a little price!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Master of the house! Keeper of the zoo! Ready to relieve'em Of a sou or two -  Watering the wine

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: But lock up your valises - Jesus! Won't I skin you to the bone!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Enter, messieurs! Lay down yer load Unlace yer boots And rest from the road. This weighs a ton Travel's a curse But here we strive To lighten your purse.

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Here the goose is cooked Here the fat is fried And nothing's overlooked Till I'm satisfied - Food beyond compare Food beyond belief

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Residents are more than welcome Bridal suite is occupied

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Servant to the poor Butler to the great Comforter, philosopher and lifelong mate Everybody's boon companion Gives'em everything he's got -

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Dirty bunch of geezers Jesus! What a sorry little lot!

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: I used to dream That I would meet a prince But God almighty Have you seen what's happened since? `Master of the house' Isn't worth my spit! Comforter, philosopher And lifelong shit! Cunning little brain Regular Voltaire Thinks he's quite a lover But there's not much there.

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: Master and a half!

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: Don't make me laugh!

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: Hypocrite and toady And inebriate!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Everybody raise a glass!

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: Raise it up the master's arse!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Hush now, do not be afraid of me. Don't cry. Show me where you live.

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: I'm called Cosette.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Cosette?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: I found her wandering in the wood This little child, I found her trembling in the shadows. And I am here to help Cosette, And I will settle any debt you may think proper. I will pay what I must pay To take Cosette away.

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: Let me take your coat, m'sieur!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Cosette shall live in my protection.

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: You are very welcome here!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: I will not forget my vow.

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Take a glass!

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: Take a chair!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Cosette shall have a father now.

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: What to do? What to say Shall you carry our treasure away? What a gem! What a pearl! Beyond rubies is our little girl! How can we speak of debt? Let's not haggle for darling Colette!

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: Cosette!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Cosette - Dear Fantine - gone to rest - Have we done for her child what is best? Shared our bread - shared each bone - Treated her like she's one of our own! Like our own, m'sieur!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Your feelings do you credit, sir. And I will ease the parting blow. Let us not talk of bargains and bones and greed.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Now may I say we are agreed?

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: That would quite fit the bill If she hadn't so often been ill. Little dear, cost us dear! Medicines are expensive, m'sieur. Not that we begrudged a sou - It's no more than we Christians must do.

Speaker: thenardiers
Dialogue: One thing more! One small doubt! There are treacherous people about! No offence! Please reflect! Your intentions may not be correct!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: No more! Here's your price! Fifteen hundred for your sacrifice. Come, Cosette, say goodbye. Let's seek out some friendlier sky. Thank you both for Cosette - It won't take you too long to forget.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Where I go, you will be.

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: Will you be like a Papa to me?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Yes, Cosette! This is true! I'll be father and mother to you!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Not bad!

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: Not enough!

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: There's a copper at the door! What the devil have you done?

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Where's the child Cosette?

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: She's gone with a gent, Didn't tell us where they went, Didn't leave his home address.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Did you catch the fellow's name?

Speaker: madame thenardier
Dialogue: You're a bloody fool Look at what we got.

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Should have struck the iron, Struck it while it's hot.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Suddenly I see Suddenly it starts When two anxious hearts Beat as one. Yesterday I was alone Today you walk beside me Something still unclear Something not yet here Has begun. Suddenly the world Seems a different place Somehow full of grace

Speaker: nuns
Dialogue: Te lucis ante terminum Rerum Creator poscimus Ut pro tua clementia Sis praesul et custodia...

Speaker: nuns
Dialogue: Procul recedant somnia Et noctium phantasmata

Speaker: fauchelevent
Dialogue: Who's that?

Speaker: fauchelevent
Dialogue: Why, it's Monsieur Mayor!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: fauchelevent
Dialogue: Don't you remember? The cart fell on me!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Now you can do the same for me. We need a place of sanctuary. This child and I, we need to disappear.

Speaker: fauchelevent
Dialogue: In this place of Holy Orders You are brought to God's domain May the sisters grant you shelter May their prayers ease your pain.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: We'll give thanks for what is granted What the sisters may ordain Here we pray for new beginnings - Here our lives can start again.

Speaker: beggars chorus
Dialogue: Look down and see the beggars at your feet! Look down and show some mercy if you can! Look down and see the sweepings of the street!

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: `Ow do you do? My name's Gavroche! These are my people, here's my patch. Not much to look at - nothing posh! Nothing that you'd call up to scratch. This is my school, my high society! Here in the slums of St Michel. We live on crumbs of humble piety Tough on the teeth - but what the hell! Think you're poor? Think you're free? Follow me! Follow me!

Speaker: beggars chorus
Dialogue: Look down and show some mercy if you can! Look down, look down, upon your fellow man!

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: There was a time we killed the King We tried to change the world too fast. Now we have got another King, He is no better than the last. This is the land that fought for liberty - Now when we fight we fight for bread! Here is the thing about equality - Everyone's equal when they're dead. Take your place!

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Where are the leaders of the land? Where are the swells who run this show?

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Only one man, General Lamarque Speaks for the people here below!

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Lamarque is ill and fading fast - Won't last a week out, so they say.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: With all the anger in the land, How long before the Judgement Day?

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Before we cut the fat ones down to size?

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: Little he knows - Little he sees.

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Everyone here, you know your place - Brujon, Babet, Clacquesous - You, Montparnasse, watch for the law - With Eponine - take care.  No mistakes, my dears!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Please, M'sieur, come this way. Here's a child that ain't eaten today. Save a life, spare a sou! God rewards all the good that you do.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: What is this? Are you mad? No, Monsieur, you don't know what you say!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: You know me! I know you! And you'll pay what I'm due.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Another brawl in the square! Another stink in the air! Was there a witness to this? Well, let him speak to Javert!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Monsieur, these streets are not safe. But let these vermin beware, We'll see that justice is done!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Look upon this fine collection Crawled from underneath a stone. This swarm of worms and maggots Could have picked you to the bone! I know this man over here, I know his name and his trade. And on your witness, m'sieur, I'll see him suitably paid.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: But where's the gentlemen gone? And why on earth did he run?

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: You will have a job to find him! He's not all he seems to be - And that girl he trails behind him She's the child he stole from me!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Could it be he's that old jailbird That the tide now washes in? Heard my name and started running... All the omens point to him.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: And the girl who stood beside him, When I turned they both had gone. Could he be the man I've hunted? Could it be he's Jean Valjean?

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: In the absence of a victim, Dear Inspector, may I go? And remember when you've nicked him It was me what told you so.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Everyone about your business!

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: That inspector thinks he's something But it's me who runs this town! And my theatre never closes And the curtain's never down! Trust Gavroche! Have no fear! You can always find me here!

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: Cosette! Now I remember... Cosette! How can it be? We were children together. Look what's become of me.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Eponine! Who was that girl?

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: That bourgeois two-a-penny thing!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Eponine, find her for me!

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: What will you give me?

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Anything!

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: Got you all excited now, But God knows what you see in her. Aren't you all delighted now? No, I don't want your money, sir.

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: You see? I told you so! There's lots of things I know! Eponine, she knows her way around.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: There, out in the darkness A fugitive running Running from God Fallen from grace - God be my witness I never shall yield Till we come face to face - Till we come face to face...

Speaker: feuilly
Dialogue: At Rue du Bac They're straining at the leash!

Speaker: joly
Dialogue: Marius, wake up! What's wrong today? You look as if you've seen a ghost.

Speaker: grantaire
Dialogue: Some wine, and say what's going on!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: A ghost, you say? A ghost maybe! She was like a ghost to me - One minute there - then she was gone!

Speaker: grantaire
Dialogue: I am agog! I am aghast! Is Marius in love at last? I've never heard him Ooh and Aah. You talk of battles to be won

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: It is time for us all To decide who we are. Do we fight for the right To a night at the opera now? Have you asked yourselves What's the price you might pay? Is this simply a game For rich young boys to play? The colours of the world Are changing day by day -

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Had you seen her today You might know how it feels To be struck to the bone By a moment of breathless delight!

Speaker: grantaire
Dialogue: Red!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: I feel my soul on fire!

Speaker: grantaire
Dialogue: Black!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: My world if she's not there!

Speaker: students
Dialogue: Red!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: The colour of desire!

Speaker: students
Dialogue: Black!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: The colour of despair!

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Marius, you're no longer a child - I do not doubt you mean it well But now there is a higher call! Who cares about your lonely soul? We strive towards a larger goal - Our little lives don't count at all!

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: Listen! Listen to me!

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Lamarque is dead... Lamarque... His death is the hour of fate. The people's man... His death is the sign we await! On his funeral day they will honour his name With the light of rebellion ablaze in their eyes. From their candles of grief we will kindle our flame. On the tomb of Lamarque shall our barricades rise!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Dear Cosette, You're such a lonely child. How pensive, how sad you seem to me. Believe me, were it within my power I'd fill each passing hour. How quiet it must be, I can see, With only me for company.

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: There's so little I know That I'm longing to know Of the man that you were In a time long ago... There's so little you say Of the life you have known, Why you keep to yourself, Why we're always alone. So dark! So dark and deep, The secrets that you keep! In my life Please forgive what I say You are loving and gentle and good. But papa, dear papa, In your eyes I am still like that child Who was lost in a wood.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: No more words - No more words. It's a time that is dead. There are words That are better unheard, Better unsaid.

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: In my life I'm no longer a child and I yearn For the truth that you know Of the years... Years ago!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: You will learn. Truth is given by God To us all in our time, In our turn.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: In my life She has burst like the music of angels The light of the sun! And my life seems to stop As if something is over And something has scarcely begun! Eponine, you're the friend Who has brought me here. Thanks to you I am one with the Gods And heaven is near! And I soar through a world that is new, That is free!

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: Every word that he says Is a dagger in me! In my life There's been no one like him anywhere, Anywhere, where he is If he asked... I'd be his!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Waiting near!

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: Waiting here!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: A heart full of love!

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: A heart full of love! No fear, no regret!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: My name is Marius Pontmercy.

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: And mine's Cosette.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Cosette... I don't know what to say -

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: Then make no sound.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: I am lost -

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: I am found!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: A heart full of light -

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: And you must never go away, Cosette - Cosette!

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: This is a chain we'll never break.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Do I dream?

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: I'm awake.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: A heart full of love -

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: He was never mine to lose Why regret What could not be?

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: A heart full of you -

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: These are words he'll never say Not to me, not to me Not for me!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: A single look and then I knew!

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: I knew it too!

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: His heart full of love...

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: From today -

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: He will never feel this way.

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: Every day...

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Cosette! Cosette!

Speaker: montparnasse
Dialogue: This is his lair! I've seen the old fox around.

Speaker: babet
Dialogue: He keeps himself to himself He's staying close to the ground.

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: I smell profit here! Ten years ago He came and paid for Cosette. I let her go for a song. It's time we settled the debt. This'll cost him dear.

Speaker: brujon
Dialogue: What do I care Who you should rob? Gimme my share! Finish the job!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: You shut your mouth! You'll get what's yours!

Speaker: brujon
Dialogue: What have we here?

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Who is this hussy?

Speaker: babet
Dialogue: It's your brat Eponine! Don't you know your own kid? Why's she hanging about here?

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Eponine, get on home! You're not needed in this. We're enough here without you.

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: I know this house, I tell you! There's nothing here for you! Just the old man and the girl. They live ordinary lives.

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Don't interfere! You've got some gall! Take care, young miss, You've got a lot to say!

Speaker: brujon
Dialogue: She's going soft!

Speaker: clacquesous
Dialogue: Happens to all!

Speaker: montparnasse
Dialogue: Go home, Eponine! Go home, you're in the way!

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: I'm gonna scream! I'm gonna warn them here!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: One little scream and you'll regret it for a year!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Make for the sewers! Get underground! Leave her to me, Don't wait around!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: You wait, my girl! You'll rue this night! I'll make you scream! You'll scream all right!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: My God, Cosette! I heard a cry in the dark. I heard the shout of angry voices in the street.

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: Three men I saw beyond the wall... Three men in shadow moving fast!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: This is a warning to us all! These are the shadows of the past!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Must be Javert. He's found my cover at last. I've got to get Cosette away Before he returns.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: We must get away from shadows That will never let us be. Tonight we leave Cosette!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Hurry, Cosette! Prepare to leave, And say no more. Tonight we'll away!

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: Please give this to Marius! He must know where to find me.

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: And now I'm all alone again - Nowhere to turn, no one to go to. Without a home, without a friend,

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: In the rain The pavement shines like silver All the lights Are misty in the river In the darkness the trees are full of starlight And all I see is him and me forever and forever!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Gone? What do you mean?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: One day more! Another day, another destiny. This never-ending road to Calvary. These men who seem to know my crime Will surely come a second time - One day more!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: I did not live until today - How can I live when we are parted?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: One day more!

Speaker: cosette
Dialogue: Tomorrow you'll be worlds away And yet with you my world has started!

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: One more day all on my own...

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: One more day with him not caring...

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: What a life I might have known...

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: But he never saw me there.

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: One more day before the storm!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Do I follow where she goes?

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: At the barricades of freedom!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Shall I join my brothers there?

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: When our ranks begin to form -

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Do I stay and do I dare?

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Will you take your place with me?

Speaker: all
Dialogue: The time is now! The day is here! One day more!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: One day more to revolution. We will nip it in the bud. We'll be ready for these schoolboys. They will wet themselves with blood!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: One day more!

Speaker: thenardiers
Dialogue: Watch'em run amuck! Catch'em as they fall! Never know your luck When there's a free-for-all. Here a little dip, There a little touch - Most of them are goners So they won't miss much!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: My place is here! I fight with you!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: One day more!

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: One more day on my own...

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: I will join these people's heroes I will follow where they go. I will learn their little secrets, I will know the things they know.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: One more day to revolution We will nip it in the bud We'll be ready for these schoolboys -

Speaker: thenardiers
Dialogue: Watch'em run amuck Catch'em as they fall Never know your luck When there's a free-for-all!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Tomorrow we'll be far away.

Speaker: all
Dialogue: Tomorrow we'll discover What our God in heaven has in store - One more dawn! One more day! One day more!

Speaker: crowd
Dialogue: Do you hear the people sing Singing the song of angry men? It is the music of a people Who will not be slaves again!

Speaker: crowd
Dialogue: When the beating of your heart Echoes the beating of the drums There is a life about to start When tomorrow comes!

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Will you give all you can give So that our banner may advance?

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: To the barricades!

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Here upon these stones We will build our barricade. In the heart of the city We claim as our own Each man to his duty And don't be afraid.

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Wait! I will need a report On the strength of the foe.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: I can find out the truth! I know their ways, Fought their wars, Served my time In the days Of my youth.

Speaker: prouvaire
Dialogue: See! The people unite!

Speaker: grantaire
Dialogue: Pray your right

Speaker: combeferre
Dialogue: Dogs will bark!

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: Fleas will bite!

Speaker: lesgles
Dialogue: They will do what is right.

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Red, the blood of angry men!

Speaker: all
Dialogue: Black, the dark of ages past! Red, a world about to dawn! Black, the night that ends at last!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Hey, little boy, what's this I see? God Eponine the things you do!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Get out before the trouble starts! Get out, `Ponine, you might get shot!

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: I've got you worried now, I have! That shows you like me quite a lot...

Speaker: joly
Dialogue: He's back!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Listen, my friends, I have done as I said. I have been to their lines, I have counted each man. I will tell what I can. Better be warned They have armies to spare And our danger is real - We will need all our cunning To bring them to heel.

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Have faith! If you know what their movements are We'll spoil their game. There are ways that a people can fight - We shall overcome their power!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: I have overheard their plans. There will be no attack tonight. They intend to starve you out Before they start a proper fight - Concentrate their force, Hit us when it's light -

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: Liar!

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: Good evening, dear Inspector. Lovely evening, my dear! I know this man, my friends. His name's Inspector Javert! So don't believe a word he says Cause none of it's true. This only goes to show What little people can do.

Speaker: courfeyrac
Dialogue: Bravo, little Gavroche! You're the top of the class!

Speaker: prouvaire
Dialogue: So what are we going to do With this snake in the grass?

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Tie this man and take him To the tavern in there! The people will decide your fate, Inspector Javert!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Shoot me now or shoot me later - Every schoolboy to his sport! Death to each and every traitor! I renounce your people's court!

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Take this man. Bring him through. There is work we have to do.

Speaker: army officer
Dialogue: Who's there?

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: French Revolution.

Speaker: army officer
Dialogue: Fire!

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Comrades, do not fire back! Do not waste powder!

Speaker: army officer
Dialogue: Who's there? Get down!

Speaker: army officer
Dialogue: Fire!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Clear out or I'll blow up the barricade!

Speaker: army officer
Dialogue: Blow it up then and take yourself with it!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: And myself with it!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Eponine! What have you done?

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: Here... It's from Cosette... I kept it from you...

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: Don't be too hard on me...

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Eponine, you're hurt! You need some help!

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: Don't you fret, M'sieur Marius - I don't feel any pain. A little fall of rain Can hardly hurt me now. You're here - that's all I need to know And you will keep me safe And you will keep me close And rain will make the flowers grow...

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: But you will live, Eponine - Dear God above! If I could close your wounds with words of love -

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: Just hold me now, and let it be. Shelter me... Comfort me...

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: You will live a hundred years If I could show you how... I won't desert you now...

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: The rain can't hurt me now... This rain will wash away what's past And you will keep me safe And you will keep me close I'll sleep in your embrace at last.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Hush-a-bye, dear Eponine You won't feel any pain A little fall of rain Can hardly hurt you now I'm here.

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: So don't you fret, M'sieur Marius I don't feel any pain A little fall of rain Can hardly hurt me now...

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: I will stay with you Till you are sleeping.

Speaker: eponine
Dialogue: That's all I need to know And you will keep me safe

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: They were the first to fall. The first to fall upon this barricade.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Her name was Eponine! Her life was cold and dark, yet she was unafraid!

Speaker: combeferre
Dialogue: We fight here in her name...

Speaker: prouvaire
Dialogue: She will not die in vain...

Speaker: lesgles
Dialogue: She will not be betrayed...

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Gavroche! Do you know the Rue de l'Homme Arm?

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: Course I do!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Will you take this for me?

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: Letter for Cosette.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: I'll take it.

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: Something for you, something for me. Who needs charity?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: `Dearest Cosette, you have entered my soul And soon you will be gone. Can it be only a day since we met And the world was reborn? If I should fall in the battle to come Let this be my goodbye. Now that I know you love me as well It is harder to die. I pray that God will bring me home To be with you. Pray for your Marius. He prays for you.'

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: They haven't got a chance, these boys They almost certainly will die She'll be alone And she will need me all the more And we will go on as before When he is gone I dare not think like this I must find this boy

Speaker: joly
Dialogue: Here comes a man in uniform! What brings you to this place?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: I come here as a volunteer.

Speaker: joly
Dialogue: Approach and show your face!

Speaker: prouvaire
Dialogue: You wear an army uniform.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: That's why they let me through.

Speaker: joly
Dialogue: You've got some years behind you, sir.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: There's much that I can do.

Speaker: joly
Dialogue: You see that prisoner over there?

Speaker: grantaire
Dialogue: A volunteer like you!

Speaker: combeferre
Dialogue: A spy who calls himself Javert!

Speaker: grantaire
Dialogue: He's going to get it too!

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: For your presence of mind, For the deed you have done, I will thank you, M'sieur, When our battle is won.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Thank you, M'sieur.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Give me no thanks, M'sieur. There's something you can do.

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: If it is in my power.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Give me the spy Javert! Let me take care of him.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: The law is inside out. The world is upside down.

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Do what you have to do - The man belongs to you.

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: The enemy may be regrouping! Hold yourselves in readiness! Come, my friends, back to your positions! The dawn is breaking fast.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: We meet again...

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: You've hungered for this all your life. Take your revenge. How right you should kill with a knife.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: You talk too much. Your life is safe in my hands.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Don't understand...

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Get out of here.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Valjean, take care! I'm warning you.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Clear out of here!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Once a thief, forever a thief. What you want, you always steal. You would trade your life for mine. Yes, Valjean, you want a deal! Shoot me now for all I care - If you let me go, beware! You'll still answer to Javert!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: You are wrong, and always have been wrong. I'm a man no worse than any man. You are free, and there are no conditions - No bargains or petitions. There's nothing that I blame you for. You've done your duty, nothing more. No doubt our paths will cross again.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Courfeyrac, you take the watch - They may attack before it's light. Everybody keep the faith, For certain as our banner flies, We are not alone - The people too must rise!

Speaker: prouvaire
Dialogue: Here's to pretty girls Who went to our heads!

Speaker: joly
Dialogue: Here's to witty girls Who went to our beds!

Speaker: students
Dialogue: Here's to them -  And here's to you!

Speaker: grantaire
Dialogue: Drink with me to days gone by! Can it be you fear to die? Will the world remember you when you fall? Can it be your death Means nothing at all? Is your life just one more lie?

Speaker: all
Dialogue: Drink with me To days gone by! To the life That used to be! At the shrine of friendship Never say die... Let the wine of friendship Never run dry! Here's to you And here's to me!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Do I care if I should die Now she goes across the sea? Life without Cosette Means nothing at all.. Please don't weep, Cosette, Should Marius fall. Will you weep, Cosette, For me?

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: God on high Hear my prayer

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: The people have not stirred.

Speaker: feuilly
Dialogue: Enjolras! Ammunition's short.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: I will go into the streets. There are bodies all around. Ammunition to be had. Lots of bullets to be found.

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: I can't let you go.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Let me go! He's no more than a boy. I am old. I have nothing to fear.

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: I volunteer!

Speaker: courfeyrac
Dialogue: Come back, Gavroche! Don't you dare!

Speaker: joly
Dialogue: Someone pull him down right now!

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: Look at me, I'm almost there!

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: Little people know When little people fight We may look easy pickings But we've got some bite! So never kick a dog When he's just a pup - We'll fight like twenty armies And we won't give up!

Speaker: gavroche
Dialogue: So you'd better run for cover When the pup grows -

Speaker: courfeyrac
Dialogue: No-o!

Speaker: army officer
Dialogue: You at the barricades listen to this! The people of Paris sleep in their beds! You have no chance, No chance at all! Why throw your lives away?

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Let us die facing our foes! Make them bleed while we can!

Speaker: combeferre
Dialogue: Make'em pay through the nose!

Speaker: courfeyrac
Dialogue: Make'em pay for every man!

Speaker: enjolras
Dialogue: Let others rise to take our place Until the earth is free!

Speaker: grantaire
Dialogue: Long live the republic!

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: Nothing here!

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Here's a hint of gold Stuck into a tooth - Pardon me, m'sieur, You won't be needing it no more. Shouldn't be too hard to sell.

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Well, someone's got to clean'em up, my friends, Before the little harvest Disappears into the mud. Someone's got to collect their odds and ends When the gutters run with blood.

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: Here's a tasty ring Pretty little thing Heart's no longer going And he's lived his little time, But his watch is ticking yet.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: How do I get out of here?

Speaker: thenardier
Dialogue: There! That way!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: It's you, Javert! I knew you wouldn't wait too long. The faithful servant at his post once more. This man's done no wrong. And he needs his family's care.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: I warned you I would not give in! I won't be swayed!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Another hour yet And then I'm yours And all our debts are paid.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: The man of mercy comes again And talks of justice!

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Come, time is running short - Look down, Javert! He's standing in his grave!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: One more step and you die.

Speaker: valjean
Dialogue: Then I die.

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Take him, Valjean, Before I change my mind! I will be waiting... 24601!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Who is this man? What sort of devil is he? To have caught me in a trap And choose to let me go free? It was his hour at last To put a seal on my fate Wipe out the past And wash me clean off the slate! All it would take Was a flick of his knife Vengeance was his And he gave me back my life!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: Damned if I live in the debt of a thief! Damned if I yield at the end of the chase!

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: And my thoughts fly apart Can this man be believed? Shall his sins be forgiven? Shall his crimes be reprieved?

Speaker: javert
Dialogue: I am reaching but I fall And the stars are black and cold As I stare into the void Of a world that cannot hold...

Speaker: woman 1
Dialogue: Did you see them Going off to fight?

Speaker: woman 2
Dialogue: Children of the barricade Who didn't last the night.

Speaker: woman 3
Dialogue: Did you see them Lying where they died? Someone used to cradle them And kiss them when they cried.

Speaker: woman 4
Dialogue: Did you see them lying side by side?

Speaker: woman 5
Dialogue: Who will wake them?

Speaker: woman 6
Dialogue: No one ever will.

Speaker: woman 2
Dialogue: No one ever told them that A summer day can kill.

Speaker: woman 7
Dialogue: They were schoolboys Never held a gun Fighting for a new world that Would rise up like the sun.

Speaker: woman 3
Dialogue: Where's that new world Now the fighting's done?
